original: Ljung, Karl Richard Georg, leg. läkare, Göteborg, f. 10/5/08 i Sthlm av styckjunk. Richard L. o. Hulda Carlsson. G. 37 m. Anna Hermansson. Barn: Marianne f. 39, Bengt 42, Klas 44, Ann-Britt 47. — Stud:ex. 27, med. kand. 31 o. med. lic. 35 i Sthlm. E. o. und:läk. v. S:t Görans sjukh. kir. avd. 33, e. o. aman. v. Karol. inst. patolog, inst. 34 o. 35, marinläk :’Stip. över stat 35, bitr. läk. v. Vaxholms fästn. 35- 36, bitr. sjukh :läk. v. marinens sjukh. i Karlskr. kir. avd. samt avd :lälv. v. u-båtsjaktavd. o. fartygsläk. 36, marinläk. av andra gr. i res. 37, av första gr. 46, assist :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. 36-37, e. läk. v. dess radiolog. avd. 37, und :läk. där s. å., extraläk. o. t. f. und :läk. v. kvinnoklin. å Sahlgr. sjukh. 39-42, andre und :läk. v. kir. avd. å länslas. i Uddevalla 42-44, und :-läk. v. Vasa sjukh. 44-45, t. f. distr :-läk. i Gbg 46, ord. distr :läk. sed. 47, egen praktik i Gbg sed. 46. Hobby: fotografering.
translated: Ljung, Karl Richard Georg, qualified doctor, Gothenburg, born on 10/5/08 in Stockholm, son of Sergeant Richard L. and Hulda Carlsson. Married in 1937 to Anna Hermansson. Children: Marianne born in 1939, Bengt in 1942, Klas in 1944, Ann-Britt in 1947. Education: graduated from high school in 1927, received Bachelor of Medicine in 1931, and completed Medical License in 1935, all in Stockholm. Worked as junior doctor at the surgical department of St. George's Hospital from 1933, as temporary assistant at the Karolinska Institute's Pathology Department in 1934 and 1935, as Naval Physician with state scholarship from 1935, as assistant physician at the Vaxholm Fortress from 1935 to 1936, as assistant medical officer at the Navy Hospital in Karlskrona at the surgical department and submarine hunting department, as well as ship physician in 1936, as Naval Physician of the second degree in reserve from 1937, and first degree from 1946, as assistant doctor at Sahlgren Hospital's surgical department from 1936 to 1937, as trainee doctor at the radiology department from 1937, and as resident doctor from the same year, as locum doctor and then temporary doctor at Sahlgren Hospital's gynecology clinic from 1939 to 1942, as second lieutenant at the surgical department of the county hospital in Uddevalla from 1942 to 1944, as medical officer at Vasa Hospital from 1944 to 1945, as temporary district doctor in Gothenburg in 1946, and as regular district doctor since 1947, also running own practice in Gothenburg since 1946. Hobby: photography.
